modules.description: Registers the Theora decoder for use with Ogg demuxing. Enables decoding of Theora video streams from Ogg containers. Useful for applications that process or display video from Ogg files.

Generates Theora fisbone packets for Ogg skeleton streams, including configuration of start granule position, headers, and stream serial number. Works with Theora encoding parameters and Ogg packet structures. Used to create skeleton metadata packets that describe Theora video streams within Ogg containers.

This module initializes and manages the encoding process for Theora video streams, handling operations like header generation, buffer encoding, and page output. It works with Theora's `yuv_buffer` type for raw video frames and interacts with Ogg streams to produce encoded packets. Concrete use cases include setting up an encoder with specific parameters, converting granule positions to frame indices, and signaling end-of-stream conditions during video encoding.

Decodes Theora video streams from Ogg packets, producing raw YUV frame data. It processes packets to extract and initialize video metadata, then decodes frames on demand. Useful for extracting video content from Ogg files or streams containing Theora-encoded data.

This module provides functions for encoding and decoding Theora video streams within Ogg containers, handling raw YUV frame data and video metadata. It supports operations such as encoder initialization, granule position conversion, keyframe detection, and fisbone packet generation for skeleton streams. Concrete use cases include encoding video with specific resolution and bitrate settings, extracting raw frames from encoded streams, and embedding Theora stream metadata in Ogg files.
